Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an angled nozzle, decorated on the discus with a grasshopper feeding. The shoulder is decorated with ovules. The lamp stands on a raised base. Light brown clay, some mica, covered with a red-brown slip. Plaster mould.
Curator's comments: Same type as British Museum lamps GR1961,1025.9 and AES1878,1217.30 (AES38491). This is a type only made in Egypt and may be Alexandrian (Bailey 1988, 220, after Hayes in ROM 378). Loeschcke (1919) type V, shoulder-form VIIIb. Loeschcke, S. 1919. Lampen aus Vindonissa. Zϋrich.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1952)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (.3)
Cahn-Klaiber 1977 / Die antiken Tonlampen der Archäologischen Instituts der Universität Tübingen (p.194)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.20) (Phase 1)
